I must try one more time to convey the real danger with Covid-19 transmission.- It has nothing to do with the number of identified cases in Mexico.- It has EVERYTHING to do with the crowds in the international airports, in the planes themselves (miniature cruise ships, breathing everyone elses' ailments, trusting that the airlines are actually disinfecting all the surfaces...), the crowds in baggage claim, the crowds in customs, .... crowds in general, from who knows where ...- Maybe you will contract a dose and hopefully recover beautifully ... but how many people will you transmit it to that may not be as robust as you, that WON'T recover as beautifully.....This Is Going To Get Worse. I am in Mexico right now - Playa del Carmen to be exact. The numbers here are currently low - but it is essential you understand WHY they are currently low. This virus spreads ; that means countries are at different places in the virus cycle. Mexico is *just entering* phase 2 which is the spread throughout the population. It is during that phase that ALL countries see a rise in their number of cases. So, of course, Mexico numbers will begin to rise quickly now. Major resorts have shut down - including most 5* AI. But the lack of people at the resorts is the number 1 factor in those closures. It’s a money driven decision. Now, let me also say NO country has accurate numbers on this. Italy, for example, is not giving tests to people over 60 who display flu like symptoms, the exact age most susceptible and the symptoms the virus mimics. Same for France. So we can assume both countries have significantly higher than reported numbers of ill and of carriers. USA has more liberal testing restrictions do of course more numbers of each group. Mexico has neither the money nor the healthcare system to support what is needed to weather this pandemic well. I am here now. I have been for weeks. But I am leaving this week. Bats and restaurants are closed or closing early now. In another week, if the government is not totally irresponsible, they will be ordered closed. Less than 1% of the population has masks available to them. Hand sanitizer is gone and had been since I arrived. The beach yesterday was almost completely empty. Only Lido Beach Club was open and they had no food available. (Maybe Mamitas, I did not walk down that far) 1 in 5 off 5th Ave restaurants are closed. Most on 5th Ave are still open but less than 1/6 full. (They will close soon due to financial sense, I am sure) If I was not here, I would not come. They are getting g ready to enter the riskiest stage and I see little prepared to handle it despite the lo get ramp up notice they got. Just yesterday they began to look at reopening the closed Tulum hospital. That won’t be ready to open for over a month. This is a highly social society; they buy food daily or for no more than 2 days because many still don’t have means to keep it at home longer. Many are used to eating 2 meals a day out and have little to no saved resources to care for themselves and their families. And some here still don’t believe this is real or think they are genetically immune to Covid 19. This is going to move quickly across Mexico and it’s not going to be good when it does. That’s why I’m going home.
I am not a gloom and doom traveler. But I’m here now and this is what I see and believe.
